item.title: How to Start Godoc on Mac
item.description: Fish: godoc -http=:6060 &; disown (pidof godoc) Bash: godoc -http=:6060 &; disown `pidof godoc` And pidof can be installed with Homebrew.

One-liner to check MongoDB Connections
item.description: mongo --eval "JSON.stringify(db.currentOp(true))" | \ tail -n +3 | \ jq -r .inprog[].client | \ sed 's/\(.*\):.*/\1/' \ | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr dump connection information in standard JSON format remove MongoDB header extract IP:port as a list trim port sort IPs by freqencies

item.title: Counting Word Frequencies in One Line
item.description: cat book.txt | \ tr '!()[]{};:",<.>?“”‘’*/\r' ' ' | \ tr ' ' '\n' | \ grep -a -P "^[\p{L}\p{N}\-']+\$" | \ grep -a -P -v "^[\p{N}\-']+\$" | \ sed "s/'s\$//" | \ sed "s/^'//" | sed "s/'\$//" > words.txt cat words.txt | \ sort | uniq -c | \ sort -nr | \ cut -c9- > words_desc.txt replace punctuations with space; remove \r from `\r\n’ one word per line keep only words composed of unicode letters, numbers, hyphen and apostrophe remove pure numbers remove ’s remove starting and ending apostrophe output words.

item.title: How to Remove All Exited Containers & Dangling Images for Docker?
item.description: docker ps --quiet --filter=status=exited | xargs docker rm docker images --no-trunc=true --filter="dangling=true" --quiet=true | xargs docker rmi

item.title: Tips on SSH
item.description: Generate SSH keys ssh-keygen -C w@h12.io Authorize public key at remote server ssh-copy-id user@host On Mac OSX, ssh-copy-id should be installed first. brew install ssh-copy-id Generate PEM ssh-keygen -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa -e -m pem > ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pem Copy file by base64 On remote session, run base64 < myfile and copy the output. On local terminal, run base64 -d > myfile, paste the content and press ctrl+D.

item.title: How to Disable the Touchpad in Linux?
item.description: Have you ever been annoyed by accidentally touching the touchpad on your laptop when you are typing? I am using a Linux laptop with both trackpoint and touchpad so the touchpad is just an annoying redundant thing. Here is the one-liner to disable it: xinput list | grep TouchPad | grep -Po 'id=\K([0-9]+)' | xargs xinput disable
